data.title: Julie Wang - Data Scientist at Big Fish Games
data.meta_description: Julie Wang has a diverse work experience in data science, analytics, and software development.
data.text:
Julie Wang has a diverse work experience in data science, analytics, and software development. Julie is currently working as a Data Scientist at Big Fish Games since October 2021. Prior to this, they served as an Associate Data Scientist - Quantitative Research at Activision Blizzard Media from September 2020 to October 2021. Julie also gained experience as an Analytics Intern at Nintendo from June 2020 to August 2020. Before that, Julie worked as an Associate Developer, Data Science at ANNUITAS from October 2019 to May 2020.

Julie also has experience with social media and teaching, as they worked as a Social Media Fellow at Emory University from August 2016 to May 2020. Julie also served as a Teaching Assistant for Introduction to Business Analytics and Business Law courses at Emory University during specific periods. Additionally, they worked as an Analytics Intern at Emory University in June 2018.

Furthermore, Julie gained valuable software development experience through internships at Prodigy Analytics and The Home Depot. Julie worked as a Software Developer Intern at Prodigy Analytics from August 2019 to October 2019, and as a Software Engineer Intern at The Home Depot from May 2019 to August 2019.

Julie's work experience also includes a Policy and Research Internship at the Center for Civic Innovation from January 2019 to April 2019.

Overall, Julie Wang has built a strong foundation in data science, analytics, software development, and research through their various roles and internships in reputable companies such as Big Fish Games, Activision Blizzard Media, and Nintendo.

Julie Wang completed their education at Emory University - Goizueta Business School. From 2016 to 2020, they earned a Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) degree with a concentration in Theater Studies, focusing on Information Systems and Operations Management. Later, from 2019 to 2020, they pursued a Master of Science (MS) degree in Business Analytics from the same university. Julie also obtained a certification in Business Research from Emory University - Goizueta Business School, although the specific month and year of completion are not provided.
